title: President Obama to Deliver Back to School Speech September 14 | whitehouse.gov
content:
The White House
Office of the Press Secretary


For Immediate Release
August 25, 2010

 



President Obama to Deliver Back to School Speech September 14




WASHINGTON, D.C. – As students begin their school year, President Barack Obama will deliver his second annual Back-to-School Speech at 1:00 p.m. EDT on Tuesday, September 14 at Julia R. Masterman Laboratory and Demonstration School in Philadelphia, PA, a 2010 National Blue Ribbon School. The President’s Back-to-School Speech is an opportunity to speak directly to students across the country.  Last year, President Obama encouraged students to study hard, stay in school, and take responsibility for their education. 


“Every single one of you has something you’re good at. Every single one of you has something to offer. And you have a responsibility to yourself to discover what that is. That’s the opportunity an education can provide,” President Obama <
http://obamawhitehouse.archives.gov/video/President-Obamas-Message-for-Americas-Students
>  said to students last year <
http://obamawhitehouse.archives.gov/mediaresources/PreparedSchoolRemarks
> .  


President Obama’s Back-to-School Speech will be live streamed on
WhiteHouse.gov
. For more information about watching the speech, visit
obamawhitehouse.archives.gov/back-to-school
.   This event is by invitation only, and additional media coverage details will be released soon.
